History: Present history: Patient believes that the government has been trying to know his thoughts and actions through frequencies and waves entering his house via television. To protect himself and his family from it, he tried building a machine, a wave neutraliser. He had placed an online order of 236 hard drives to cover his room. They were expensive and he got the money from his mother's credit card. He was about to finish this work and required a tool that he brought from his neighbour's garage. He was also covering his neighbour's house on the grid thinking it would protect him too. As soon as he came back home, police reached his place and admitted him in the hospital. He had not been sleeping at all as he felt it was a waste of time and was more focussed on building the machine.
Current Mental Status Examination: Behavior: Patient was cordial and rapport could be established; Thought: content- Preoccupation with suspicion on government and building th machine to protect him from them.
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient's suspicion on government was discussed as he was trying to build a machine  to cover his room and save himself from the government. He was later on brought to the hospital by the police and was admitted was a week. He believed that he medications were changed by the government.
